result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Rose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both counts 3 & 4 are concurrent with each other and also concurrent with La Crosse Co cases 14CM1586 & 15CM362, with same conditions also concurrent

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Undergo any other assessment or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Remaining cash bond of $57 is applied to financial obligations owed - SEE ASSESSMENT REPORT

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 6 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoke or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
The balance of the sentence can be served on Electronic Monitoring through Justice Support Services at def's mother's residence

Unpaid Court financial obligations on Cts 3 & 4 are converted to a Civil Judgment - the defendant is to pay $10 per month with the first payment due 6-1-17
.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with La Crosse Co case 15CM362
.

.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Ct 3 of this case
.

to Jeff S., JSS   from Judge Todd L Ziegler   re: rec'd letter dated 8-13-15.  Next Hrg is set for 8-24-15 @ 1:30.  Judge Ziegler req that JSS provide him w/ update the morning of 8-24-15 regarding def's compliance w/ JSS

State by Kellis /  Def w/ Atty Sasa Johnen
Kellis:  this will not be prelim hrg - I am filling in for ADA Vasupuram, it's my understanding that officer is not available & we will Waive time limits today & an oral ruling on Reckless Endangerment
Johnen:  I was informed by ADA Vasupuram that officer was unavailable - we're still trying to resolve these matters.  Def was not prepared to Waive time limits - I don't know if that changes anything but that is our position - def is requesting Prelim Hrg held w/in the time limits
CRT:  that only gives us one more day for time limits - I'm assuming Mr. Kellis you would ask that we go beyond time limits?
Kellis:  yes - req CRT find good cause
CRT:  I know this isn't your case, but do you have any notes from ADA Vasupuram why she did not notify CRT of this issue
Kellis:  I don't know - I see note in file that officer wasn't available & Def was notified right away
Johnen:  The Def had requested to have this Hrg today to address bond & that is one of reasons why Your Honor was not notified earlier
CRT:  This isn't Mr. Kellis's issue but ADA Vasupuram should have known to notify CRT right away to see if we could have found another time - we could have found time late last week -- I'm prepared to give the ruling in the previous case
CRT FINDS GOOD CAUSE TO GO BEYOND TIME LIMITS FOR PRELIM
15CF404 ONLY----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CRT:  I did receive a Brief/Memo from State & one today from Mr. Johnen.  The evidence from PH was consistent w/ taht in criminal complaint - I'm satisfied there is PC for Ct 2 - Ct 1 is being dismissed for lack of PC
Kellis:  Given CRT's ruling, I don't know if you want to schedule the Arraignment -
CRT:  File the Info w/in the statutory time frame & we can do the Arraignment when we do the PH in 15CF456
Johnen addresses bond - def has moved in w/ his grandfather & removed himself from that neighborhood - given he's been on House Arrest for more than a month, we'd ask CRT to consider removing the House Arrest condition
Kellis asks that bond conditions remain as previously ordered
CRT:  I would have liked someone from JSS to send me a letter or appear here today to tell me if there had been any violations - no change in bond at this time - I will reconsider it at our next Hrg - all files will be on at next Hrg - if Def has been in compliance w/ no violations I will reconsider the bond the way it is
Prelim Hrg:  to be set (all cases will be called)

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
State by Vasupuram & Suleski  /  Def w/ Atty Joseph Geraldson
New Complaint - Court advises def of new charges / reads entire complaint to def
CRT has also rec'd an additional JSS violation today for missing PBT on 6-21-15 
CRT finds Prob Cause on face of Complaint to proceed - asks def if he would like Prelim Hrg
Geraldson:  Yes
CRT:  Def is to be booked on the new charges - I'm going to see how well def does w/ officers in having that accomplished.  If def can behave self while officers take him to jail & get him booked, CRT will take def's $400 as cash bond & allow def to have home arrest while this case is pending.  If def is not good w/ officers, def will be in 1:30 Intake CRT & bond will be a lot higher
CRT:  Def to turn keys over to JSS for them to hold - def cannot drive the vehicle until properly reinstated.  Def's mother can come & pick up vehicle or def can call Triple A - they can pick up key from JSS & then can give them back to JSS to hold for def - def will be on house arrest w/ EM, which will require you to be in your home & only time def can leave his home is w/ permission from JSS.  CRT will remove the testing so def won't have to come in & test
CRT:  $400 cash bond required w/ conditions:  No Contact w/ K.H. or her family or residence;  No Contact w/ T.B., his family or residence;  No alcohol;  No driving;  After posting cash, CRT will ask that officer deliver def to his home after his JSS equipment has been put in place;  Def will have to figure out someplace else to keep his vehicle other than his house;  CRT will reconsider House Arrest after 30 days w/o violation of the exclusion zone - JSS will set the Exclusion Zone
CRT:  Def to be taken by CRT Officer for Booking;  A new Pub Def will be apptd for new Felony charge
CRT:  since victim is JSS employiee, CRT will request an out-of-county Judge to here this case - CRT will find just cause to continue the Prelim Hrg - a new judge will have to be assigned
Prelim Hrg to be set w/ new judge
NOTE:  CRT RESET BOND TO $350 CASH REQUIRED - BOOKING WAS CALLED & TOLD OF NEW AMOUNT
